answers.answer: There is some research that suggests kids born to moms who ate an excessive amount of sugar in pregnancy are at higher risk for diabetes.  Please talk this over with your doctor and try to figure out a diet that reduces your sugar cravings.
i already gave birth.. now i am breastfeeding... before i dont eat lots of sweet when i was pregnant.. will that affect??? now???

It just seems like you are taking in way more sugar than the human body is really built to take in.  Please talk to your doctor about the consequences, and please take seriously that any substance that you eat does go into your breast milk.
oh!! thanks annie.. i'd better see my doctor soon.. :)

For your health and that of your baby the best thing you can do is eat a well balanced diet including plenty of lean protiens and fresh fruits and vegetables. Chocolate can also make some breast fed babies fussy and gassy

Hahaha! Oh, I so understand! I love my sugar fix (especially chocolate) too! But, yes, the thing to do is to try to make sure your diet is filled with nutritional foods. Just like how I gave up smoking when trying to get pregnant and still don't now because of breastfeeding even though the craving for one gets intense...I also try to keep my "junk food" to a minimum. All that we put into our bodies goes into the milk supply.  I also want to continue with a more healthy lifestyle after breastfeeding to be a good influence. It isn't easy sometimes!

your milk will always be healthy for your baby, but they do have a good point about your health!Some babies with reflux have worse symptoms if mom eats chocolate or anything with caffeine. Otherwise, it shouldn't harm the baby.
